Package eutros.multiblocktweaker.crafttweaker.gtwrap.interfaces

Interface IICubeRenderer

All Superinterfaces:
gregtech.client.renderer.ICubeRenderer, codechicken.lib.texture.TextureUtils.IIconRegister
public interface IICubeRenderer extends gregtech.client.renderer.ICubeRenderer
Used in MultiblockBuilder.withBaseTexture(IICubeRenderer) to set the texture of the controller, and that of all the components, when the multiblock forms.
See Also:
  • MultiblockBuilder
ZenClass:
mods.gregtech.render.ICubeRenderer

  • Method Details

    • byPath

      @Nullable static @Nullable IICubeRenderer byPath(@NotNull @NotNull String path)
      Get a ICubeRenderer by path from original CEu.
      Parameters:
      path - The path of the cube renderer.
      Returns:
      The cube renderer referenced by the path, or null.

    • simpleOverlay

      static IICubeRenderer simpleOverlay(String key, String path)
      Create a SimpleOverlayRenderer with all sides showing the given texture.

      If the texture is registered in the CEu, will use the default one. Otherwise, this must be registered in preinit. Use #loader preinit in a separate script and define it there first.

      Normal texture: format("blocks/%s", basePath)

      Emissive texture (Optional): format("blocks/%s_emissive", basePath)

      Parameters:
      key - Searching key for bracket.
      path - The resource location pointing to the texture to use.
      Returns:
      An IICubeRenderer.

    • sidedOverlay

      static IICubeRenderer sidedOverlay(String key, Map<crafttweaker.api.world.IFacing,String> map)
      Get a sided SidedCubeRenderer (i.e. different sides can have different textures).

      IFacing.up() is the only mapping that is required, blanks will be filled in as such:

      If DOWN is not defined, it will be mapped to UP. NORTH will be resolved as the first defined horizontal side in the order NORTH, EAST, SOUTH, WEST, otherwise UP. WEST, SOUTH and EAST will be mapped to NORTH if they are not defined yet.

      Normal texture: format("%s", basePath)

      Emissive texture (Optional): format("%s_emissive", basePath)

      If the texture at a given location is not already used by something else, it must be registered in preinit. Use #loader preinit in a separate script and define it there first.

      Parameters:
      key - Searching key for bracket.
      map - A mapping of sides to texture resource locations.
      Returns:
      An IICubeRenderer with all sides showing the given texture.

    • sidedOverlay

      static IICubeRenderer sidedOverlay(String key, @Nonnull String up, String north, String east, String south, String west, String down)
      same as sidedOverlay(String, Map)
      Parameters:
      key - Searching key for bracket.
      up - The texture to use for the top face.
      north - (Optional) The texture to use for the north face.
      east - (Optional) The texture to use for the east face.
      south - (Optional) The texture to use for the south face.
      west - (Optional) The texture to use for the west face.
      down - (Optional) The texture to use for the bottom face.
      Returns:
      An IICubeRenderer with all sides showing the given texture.

    • orientedOverlay

      static IICubeRenderer orientedOverlay(String key, String path, ConstantOverlayFace... faces)
      Create a OrientedOverlayRenderer with textures of five oriented sides of the machine and its working state.

      FRONT MetaTileEntity.getFrontFacing()

      BACK MetaTileEntity.getFrontFacing().EnumFacing.getOpposite()

      TOP EnumFacing.UP

      BOTTOM EnumFacing.DOWN

      SIDE EnumFacing.NORTH + EnumFacing.SOUTH + EnumFacing.EAST + EnumFacing.WEST

      Normal texture: format("blocks/%s/overlay_%s", basePath, faceName)

      Active state texture (Optional): format("blocks/%s/overlay_%s_active", basePath, faceName)

      Pause state texture (Optional): format("blocks/%s/overlay_%s_paused", basePath, faceName)

      Emissive texture (Optional): format("blocks/%s/overlay_%s_%s_emissive", basePath, faceName, state)

      If the texture is registered in the CEu, will use the default one. Otherwise, this must be registered in preinit. Use #loader preinit in a separate script and define it there first.

      Parameters:
      key - Searching key for bracket.
      path - The resource location pointing to the texture to use.
      faces - Available faces of the texture. ConstantOverlayFace
      Returns:
      An IICubeRenderer.

    • fromBlock

      static IICubeRenderer fromBlock(crafttweaker.api.block.IBlock block)
      Get an IBlockStateRenderer from a block.

      This will typically only work with blocks that have conventional models.

      Equivalent to block as ICubeRenderer.

      Parameters:
      block - The block whose textures should be used.
      Returns:
      An IICubeRenderer textured the same as the given block.

    • fromBlock

      static IICubeRenderer fromBlock(crafttweaker.api.item.IItemStack stack)
      Get an IBlockStateRenderer from a block.

      This will typically only work with blocks that have conventional models.

      Equivalent to stack as IBlock as ICubeRenderer.

      Parameters:
      stack - The IItemStack of block whose textures should be used.
      Returns:
      An IICubeRenderer textured the same as the given block.

    • fromState

      static IICubeRenderer fromState(crafttweaker.api.block.IBlockState state)
      Get an IBlockStateRenderer from a block state.

      This will typically only work with blocks that have conventional models.

      Equivalent to state as ICubeRenderer.

      Parameters:
      state - The block state whose textures should be used.
      Returns:
      An IICubeRenderer textured the same as the given block state.
